headline: Lobster Colorado
description: Bacon-wrapped filet mignons are broiled and topped with lobster meat for a very special dinner. Elegant for dinner parties or a romantic dinner for two. If you desire crabmeat instead of lobster, go for it!
name: Lobster Colorado
recipeIngredient: 8 ounces lobster tail, cleaned and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Set oven to Broil at 500 degrees F (260 degrees C).

Sprinkle tenderloins all over with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Wrap each filet with bacon, and secure with a toothpick. Place on a broiling pan, and broil to desired doneness, about 8 to 10 minutes per side for medium rare.

While tenderloins are cooking, melt 1/4 cup of butter over medium heat with 1/2 teaspoon Old Bay® seasoning. Stir in chopped lobster meat, and cook until done. Spoon lobster meat over cooked tenderloins, and return them to the broiler until the lobster meat begins to brown.

While the lobster is in the oven, heat the remaining 1/4 cup of butter in a small saucepan over medium-high heat, cook until it browns, turning the color of a hazelnut. To serve, spoon the browned butter over the steaks, and sprinkle with the remaining Old Bay® seasoning.

review.reviewBody: SO GOOD!!
It was delicious my boyfriend loved it. I added broccoli and brussel sprouts.
Great recipe!

OUT-FREAKIN-STANDING!!!! This is just phenomenal every time I make it! My husband loves this dish! It's perfect as is! We actually prefer with ribeyes rather than filet mignon but it is excellent either way. This recipe is definitely a keeper!!

Made the recipe exactly as written. It
was delicious!
This is so good and so simple! Set off the fire alarms twice while making it though lol
Very decadent!
I followed recipe to the letter for NYE dinner. It was fantastic!! I will definitely keep this one in my back pocket for special occasions.
This was exceptional for Christmas dinner! Cooked the filets in my Sous vide then did a reverse sear and finished topped with lobster under broiler! Rave reviews from all. Easy and elegant!

So I made this for my wife 7 years ago for Valentine’s Day with a Lemon Garlic broccoli recipe. She loved it so much it has become a tradition every year. It is an easy recipe and is absolutely wonderful.
This was absolutely amazing! The brown butter was a rich and sweet touch!
Absolutely perfect!
My family loved it!!!

Very elegant and simple dish to prepare. I did make my own butter garlic sauce to top off everything at the end. The broiling times were pretty accurate, although I started checking after about six minutes. I only use time as a guide, but temperature is the key.
The best steak and lobster I have EVER had!!
This recipe was so delicious. my family enjoyed it. I would make this again !
I make a cheaper version of this using top sirloin (still bacon wrapped) and shrimp. I call it Lobster Oklahoma...
Easy and delicious!
Made this for a romantic valentines dinner. Quick and easy to do and yet very pretty and tasty. I would have cut the lobster up a bit more than I did.
GREAT. Increased lobster as I am not a big steak fan but my husband is. This was an easy recipe to follow and I will definitely make it again for special occasions.
Incredibly good. Instead of filets I used Kobe sirloins, and everyone raved about how good they were. And don’t be shy with the Old Bay seasoning.
Delicious! Only thing I substituted was Tony’s Creole Seasoning for Old Bay because I thought I had some but alas I did not. Will try with Old Bay next time!

I have made this recipe for Valentine's Day 2017, New Years Eve 2017and now my boyfriend is going to make it for me Valentine's Day 2018. It is easy and delicious and now a special occasion favorite for us.
Best steak I've ever made or tasted! So tender even when cooked well done. Perfect Valentine's Day meal! I once substituted crab meat on top when I didn't have lobster.

My husband and I just love this. I usally buy more lobster for extra and use a little less bay seasoning. Great meal to impress.
I sear the filets in a (med-high heat) cast iron skillet for 2. 1/2 -3 minutes each side first, then transfer the skillet to the 450 degree preheated oven for 5-7 more minutes placing the lobster/butter mixture towards the last few minutes.

This came out great!! I added a little garlic to the butter and didn't brown the lobster bc I have a bottom broiler in my oven and its hard to watch the food to make sure it didn't over cook but it was delicious!! My husband loved it. I did about 7 minutes on each side of the steak for med rare and for the thicker steaks about 8-9 minutes (they were about 4 inches thick)
Absolutely delicious!!! I sautéed the lobster and added it on top vs putting it in the oven afraid of over cooking it. Definitely making it again!!!

Made this for Valentine Dinner. I cooked the lobster tails the way Chef John cooked his on the Lobster Newberg video. They were fabulous. I did add the splash of white wine as other reviewers suggested. Served with roasted asparagus and the Marscapone Mashed potatoes. Delicious and special dinner.
just made it for the new years and the general opinion was exceptional.

Made this for my husbands Birthday dinner versus going out to eat. Had 5 filets, and enough lobster to go around. All I heard was how delicious this was. I am now adopting this as our "Special" meal for special days. Thank you for your submission.
Made this for our first meal of 2017, family loved it!
All I can say is AMAZING! Tender, delicious, easy to make! I will definitely be making this again.
Meat, lobster, butter...yes, pretty darn good!

I thought this recipe looked amazing, but my husband doesn't eat shellfish and we couldn't afford filet mignon, so I improvised. I started with a small chuck roast. I then cut it into 1 inch squares and ran through a meat grinder. I formed these into patties and put on the grill for 10-15 minutes. Served on a toasted bun with ketchup and mustard. Outstanding. Will definitely make this recipe again.

SO GOOD!!! This time I realized too late that I didn't have any Old Bay seasoning at home so I used garlic butter, olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, touch of Worcestershire, Italian seasoning, splash of soy sauce and teriyaki sauce, and some taco seasoning and it was crazy good!!!
Great.
My husband and I have used it for special occasions since I found the recipe. EXCELLENT!

This is the best steak I have ever had at home and at some restaurants! I made this for Valentines Day and my husband loved it! I changed nothing! Thanks so much for a great recipe! Also I must add I have no cooking skills and this was very easy for me to prepare. It tastes like it took hours to prepare but it was about 15 min including cook and prep time!

I made this for Valentine's Day and it was mouthwatering! I followed the advice from the other reviews and got top of the line filet mignon and I'm glad I did. I followed the recipe exactly and it was really perfect. I served it with roasted asparagus and baked potato. A lovely dinner for a special occasion!

Great recipe! I couldn't get good fresh lobster where we live this time of year so substituted with large shrimp and cut the butter in half... big hit with the family! My mom has requested it for Mother's Day!
This was really easy to prepare and possibly the best thin I have ever eaten!!!
It turned out AMAZING....

This is really superb and it calls for my first review! My husband doesn't normally eat steak and devoured it. He said it was better than the expensive fish house downtown. I placed it on a bed of homemade garlic mashed potatoes. I went a little overboard with the Old Bay and used more than the recipe called for, and more than I should have, but still very yummy!!
Good recipe... Thankfully I caught the typo with the meat timing

WONDERFUL! I used the search and entered steak and lobster because that's what I had in my freezer. I overcooked my steaks (my fault...new oven) but it was still great. Heck, even an over cooked steak is good with butter, Old Bay Seasoning and lobster! LOL
broiled for way too long

Oh, yum! I made this for our family's Valentine's Day dinner, and everyone loved it! I'm not a fan of Old Bay seasoning, so I omitted it, but otherwise I followed the recipe very closely. So good, can't wait to make this again.
This was easy and dilisious!!my little family loved it! I'm not sure how to prepare it as leftovers because there is a lot left!

It was very good i used the butter I cooked the lobster in as my brown butter
I added a little fresh lemon it adds so much 
and I didn't put the lobster in the oven so as to not over cook, steak was a perfect rare.
but it was a good basic recipe.
It was so good, we made it again for New Year's day!
I used no seasoning to the lobster and just sautéed it in butter then added to the filet. No need to cover the taste of Maine lobster with seasoning. Other then that great recipe.
Thank you very much, I made it as the recipe called for and the family was delighted! Excellent flavor!
Effortless Perfection! A big hit in the galley...look forward to serving this again

When I ask my husband what he wants for dinner, I ALWAYS get the same response -- Steak and Lobster. So for Valentine's Day I thought I'd give him what he wants, and hopefully shut him up for a while. ;-) 
I can't really say anything negative about this recipe because it was so flippin' great! I am not much of a beef eater, and I always leave the steak cooking to my husband, but this gorgeous piece of meat came out so tender that it almost does not need to be chewed. Perfection. I would probably double the amount of lobster next time I make it, but that would be the only thing I'd change. Thank you for a great recipe. I am sure he will be asking me for it again in the near future.
I made this for NYE and my boyfriend said it was the best thing he's ever eaten. Don't mess with the recipe, it's perfect! I cannot wait to make it again! SO SO SO good.

I followed this recipe for Valentines Day filets this year, and they were outstanding. I have never cooked steak indoors (always grilled outside), and this recipe gave me perfect results. I did substitute the lobster and browned butter for shrimp in a scampi butter sauce. No changes to the filets though, thanks very much for sharing :)
OMgosh...this was fabulous. I made this as written (minus the bacon), and it turned out fantastic. Even the picky 11 year old gobbled it up. Will definitely make this again.
I made this for my husband and myself for Valentine's Day and we loved this surf & turf dish. The caramelized butter really just tops it off.

Hubby said its the best thing I've ever made!! Also said I could make it as often as I wanted. Lol! This says a lot bc I have a very discriminating husband. I put the Montreal steak seasonings on it too.
One of the BEST dinners my husband and I have made in almost 5 years! We made it with asparagus and crab cakes, with a good Malbec! It's a must!
Fantastic!! So easy and absolutely delicious!!
Awesome! I made this for Valentine's Day dinner and my husband loved it!

This is my first review but I just had to write one for this awesome recipe. Like other reviewers I grilled my steaks instead of using the broiler. Keep in mind that grilling the steaks takes a little longer than in the broiler directions included in this recipe. I half cooked my steaks and then started the lobster which was the perfect amount of time. I also used 1/4 tsp of garlic with my butter and doubled the amount of lobster. Delicious!

This recipe is the bomb. I made it with ground beef and those imitation crab sticks and it still got me laid. I also didn't have any Old Bay so I sprinkled shredded coconut on top. The perfect Valentine's Day dish!

What can I say that has not already been said about this recipe...my first time broiling filet, I was terrified, but it turned out PERFECT! My only change was to add a little white wine to the butter while I sauteed the lobster meat. I had the camera out to take a picture, but I couldn't wait to dig in, I completely forgot to take it :) ....OUTSTANDING recipe!!!

Thank you. Thank you . Thank you. I am not a steak eater. My husband and kids are so deprived because we always eat chicken and fish and sometimes pork. This year I wanted to move away from the usual turkey or ham dinner for Christmas, so I thought I would try this. I was very afraid that I was going to spend all this money and end up screwing up the recipe. Steaks always come out tough for me. I was sure I could manage to make tenderloins tough too. But it was perfect! We now have a new tradition. Now I can't wait for next Christmas to do it all again.

Made this prior to going on vacation.....We had a hard time finding a better dish while dining in some of the best restaurants on the east coast. To make it an all in one dish, I made spinach sautéed in garlic/mushrooms and fresh parmesan cheese to layer in between filet and lobster. Incredibly easy and rewarding!

Yep; it was as good as they say. Simple and tasty. Make sure you mince the lobster or it'll fall off the steak. Broil another tail that has been drenched in the butter mixture and serve it beside the steak for a true surf and turf. Excellent! This is my cardiologist's favorite recipe.

Yep; it was as good as they say. Simple and tasty. Make sure you mince the lobster or it'll fall off the steak. Broil another tail that has been drenched in the butter mixture and serve it beside the steak for a true surf and turf. Excellent! This is my cardiologist's favorite recipe.
Absolutely amazing. Made this for Mother's Day for my family. They thought I was the best dad ever.
VERY yummy! A new tradition in our house for Father's Day!
DH loved, loved, loved this recipe....what is there NOT to love! Sinfully delicious!

I made this for valentines day and it was scrumptious. I substituted thinly sliced garlic cloves for the old bay seasoning in the first step but kept it in the browned butter. Simple elegance. We both loved it.
Cooked to perfection! Really easy but makes you look like a master chef!
This was SO GOOD.I made this for my man for Valentines Day and he was completely impressed. Didn't change a thing about the recipe-but I did BBQ my steak. Me and broilers do not mix ;-)
Being from Colorado, this was the perfect choice for a New Year's Eve dinner. This was fabulous.
Prepared this dish on New Years Eve - pretty easy prep with decadent results. Served Roasted Brussels Sprouts and Laura's Lemony Potatoes as sides. Got the lobster tails from Costco - great buy!
I served this as part of our Christmas Day dinner. Everybody loved it and I'm sure they will request it again next year.

This recipe was fast, easy and delicious! I made it for my DH's birthday dinner--he was impressed with the presenation and the overall meal. I used 1 slice of thick cut bacon per filet but next time I will use 2 since the cooked bacon unwrapped and wouldnt wrap around completely. Some adjustments I made to the recipe: I used Steak Seasoning for the filets and only a pinch Old Bay (after reading a few reviews). Also, I melted 1/2 cup of butter for the lobster and used the excess to top it off at the end.
This recipe was delicious. Served it for friends on New Years Eve, and they loved it. Served with a baby red potatoes and a salad.
I made this for Valentine's Day, it was excellent.
perfect valentines day dinner!
My husband made this for Valentine's dinner and it was hands down one of the best meals I've ever had! Delicious!!!

Very easy! Great Taste! Tried it for the first time last night - yummy...In my oven 8 minutes per side on top rack in oven actually resulted in well done - but that's the way I prefer it. If you're really aiming for medium rare, may want to start checking at 6 minutes depending on thickness and position in the oven.
Delicious!

Since Valentine's Day 2012 is upon us, I actually remembered the name of this recipe and printed it out again. I made this last year for Valentine's Day and it is definitely "worthy" of the occasion. I did (and will do again) about everything the other reviewers recommended...lighten up on the Old Bay, add a splash of white wine to the lobster, don't cook lobster "til done"...cook it "till almost done" as oven finishes it off. Truly a simple and remarkable meal....and I cannot believe I forgot to review it last year!
I love this recipe. I'm saving this for my girlfriend and those romantic nights only. Yeah right!!!!

Followed you recipe and feel in live with it. My one error was that I think I cut the lobster up a bit too small. I'll get it right next time. I made this for parents and they loved it too! Thank you.
I used 2 bay leaves instead of old bay, and it was still awesome!!!

Amazing, amazing, amazing. I loved the browned butter spooned over top and gave it such richness. It was a perfect medium rare and so tender. Hubby kept going on about how awesome the filet turned out. Loved this so much!!
So easy and so simple to make! At the end, we ate this with asparagus and mashed potatoes. Perfect combination!

This was easy an delicious!!!!! The meat was very tender and I like the meat well done. The butter was just the right touch to keep it juicy and it was excellent to rub the lobster in the butter because it also had the flavors of the beef mixed in! I made it just as the recipe said, didn't change or modify a thing. The old bay was perfect flavoring for his dish! Will definitely make again and again!Thanks!
absolutely AMAZING.
Tried this on Saturday night, also trying a new stove, but it was delicious, only thing I changed was the lobster in butter & garlic, insead of the Old Bay Seasoning

Quick. Easy. Awesome.
Tweak it as you will, this basic recipe is sure to please.

What an awesome Valentines day recipe. I changed it up a little. Doubled the lobster, BBQ'd the filet, cut the old bay in half & added 1 tsp of garlic powder instead of the old bay to the melted butter for the final topping

We made this for Valentine's Day dinner on saturday 2-12-11 and it was soo delicious. My husband said he has never had a better steak before, we will be making this again for sure. Made just as the recipe calls for. :)

WOW is all I can say!! I served this to my husband and sons for Valentines dinner tonight. I bought 8 tenderloins and, my guys went NUTS! They were hoping there was more!! This recipe is definitely restaurant quality and I wouldn't hesitate serving it to guests! THANKS for such a wonderful recipe!
Delicious, incredibly easy and super impressive for any dinner date with that special gal - trust me ;)
